intro: Rinorea dinklagei, commonly known as the Dinklage's rinorea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species in botanical studies.
